item.title: Death Stranding 2‚Äôs Exoskeleton Releases Next Month
item.content:encoded:
You can purchase and wear the Exoskeleton from Death Stranding 2 starting in December 2025; however, limited stock is available.

As players wait for Death Stranding to reach new mediums, with A24 set to tell an original story, and another animated film in the works as well, players can look forward to something tangible in the coming months. Kojima Productions has partnered with Dnsys to bring a co-branded DS2 Exoskeleton, and here‚Äôs all you need to know about it.

Death Stranding 2 Exoskeleton Works Similar to the Ones in the Game

The collaboration between Kojima Productions and Dnsys for the Death Stranding 2: On the Beach limited edition exoskeleton was revealed through an official post on X (formerly Twitter). It was co-designed by Yoji Shinkawa, the art director from Kojima Productions, and the DNSYS team. The Dnsys Z1 Exoskeleton Pro is scheduled to release on December 2, 2025.

Similar to the game, the Death Stranding 2 Dnsys Z1 Exoskeleton Pro will help provide users with a mobility boost when traveling through complex terrains and environments. Users will experience a leg enhancement that provides 50% extra power to their steps. They will also receive an endurance boost, which increases their hiking range by 15.5 miles and vertical climbing by 9.3 miles.

The exoskeleton will provide knee pressure relief, with users able to offload ‚Äúup to 200%‚Äù of their body weight from the knees, and it also helps. Instantly feel up to 44‚ÄØlbs lighter during vertical movements. The device will provide ‚ÄúAI gait control across rugged trails, stairs, and slopes,‚Äù and users can look forward to ‚Äú4+ hours of continuous support, with quick-swap batteries.‚Äù

In other news, Hideo Kojima has written the concept for Death Stranding 3, but will not be making it. item.title: Helldivers 2 Xbox Port Helped Increase PS5 and PC Sales
item.content:encoded:
It has been revealed that the release of Helldivers 2 on Xbox helped increase engagement as well as sales for the PS5 and PC versions.

Arrowhead Game Studios released Helldivers 2 for Xbox in August 2025, and that decision helped revitalise the game for a new platform of players. It was also revealed earlier this year that Helldivers 2 sold more on Xbox than PlayStation in its first six days, and now, it seems that the Xbox port has also helped bolster sales on other platforms.

Helldivers 2 Xbox Port Helped Provide a ‚ÄúSignificant Increase in Sales‚Äù for PS5 and PC

Spotted by This Week in Video Games (via TheGamer), Sony Group CFO Lin Tao spoke about Helldivers 2‚Äôs Xbox port contributing towards PS5 and PC sales during a Q&A portion of the company‚Äôs earnings call. Tao first talked about how their live service titles ‚Äúoverall accounted for more than 40% of our first-party software revenue.‚Äù Even though performance is different for each title, they observed that live service games are ‚Äúa recurring source of revenue‚Äù similar to the previous quarter.

Tao then spoke about Helldivers 2, stating that it was also released for Xbox in 2025 and ‚Äúis doing extremely well.‚Äù The group CFO added that the Xbox port has not only helped bring in new players on Xbox but also increased engagement from existing users on PS5 and PC. This move has ‚Äúresulted in a significant increase in sales of the title year on year.‚Äù Tao concluded, stating, ‚ÄúBuilding on this recent progress, we aim to strengthen our studio, business, and expand our IP franchises through continuous learning and improvement.‚Äù

In other news, the developers of Helldivers 2 are ‚Äòlooking into‚Äò GameGuard anti-cheat. Additionally, Arrowhead Game Studios has started work on a new game. item.title: New Legend of Zelda LEGO Set Coming in 2026
item.content:encoded:
LEGO has announced that a new Legend of Zelda set is coming in 2026, though details on what exactly it entails are scarce.

The partnership between LEGO and Nintendo has seen a host of epic sets released, including the Legend of Zelda Great Deku Tree 2-in-1 set and a host of Super Mario sets, and the catalogue is being expanded upon next year.

LEGO Teases New Legend of Zelda Set
